Claims "will not be entertained"


Not a Flying Saucer
Only a Cowling Wreck

  • The Springfield [Mass.] Daily News
    Friday, July 11, 1947
Due warning is hereby given anyone in the Berkshire Ave. area that claims of finding the debris of a flying saucer will not be entertained because it will be the cowling from a C-54 four-engined transport that was lost while in flight yesterday.

The cowling is of an aluminum color and may have been flattened into a saucer-like shape through impact with the ground.

Only one person has reported seeing the cowling fall from the plane and he lost out on a chance to claim it was a saucer by swiftly identifying it as a part of the plane.
 

End of article
